Adjust a covariance matrix for Common Method Variance (CMV)

Source: R/me_cmv_cov.R
me_cmv_cov.Rd

me_cmv_cov accepts an medesign object specified in medesign and adjusts the covariance coefficients of common method variables with the reliability and validity coefficients from me_data. Optionally, you can supply the CMV coefficients manually in the argument cmv.

me_cmv_cov(.medesign, cmv = NULL)

Arguments

.medesign

An medesign object given by medesign
cmv

an optional numeric vector of the same length as the number of common method variance specifications in .mdesign. This argument is left available if the user has reasons to input their own CMV. By default, it is set to NULL and it is calculated internally.

Value

The common-method-variance corrected correlation.

See also

link{medesign} and me_cmv_cor for the same adjustment but for a covariance matrix.

Examples


set.seed(2131)
library(tibble)

original_df <- as.data.frame(matrix(rnorm(100, sd = 50), nrow = 20))

# Toy quality dataset
me_df <-
 tibble(question = paste0("V", 1:5),
 quality = c(0.2, 0.3, 0.5, 0.6, 0.9),
 reliability = c(0.6, 0.4, 0.5, 0.5, 0.7),
 validity = c(0.79, 0.9, 0.6, 0.7, 0.8))

# Define mdesign object
m_obj <- medesign("~ V4 + V5", original_df, me_df)

# Original correlation matrix
me_covariance(original_df)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 6
#>   rowname    V1    V2     V3     V4    V5
#>   <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 V1      2411.  129.   608.   445.  229.
#> 2 V2       129. 1653.   784.  -282.  618.
#> 3 V3       608.  784.  2446. -1146. -574.
#> 4 V4       445. -282. -1146.  2772. -181.
#> 5 V5       229.  618.  -574.  -181. 3531.

# Coefficient of correlation changes
# when adjusting for common method variance
me_cmv_cov(m_obj)
#> # A tibble: 5 x 6
#>   rowname    V1     V2      V3      V4     V5
#>   <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 V1        0.2  129.    608.    445.   229. 
#> 2 V2      129.     0.3   784.   -282.   618. 
#> 3 V3      608.   784.      0.5 -1146.  -574. 
#> 4 V4      445.  -282.  -1146.      0.6 -634. 
#> 5 V5      229.   618.   -574.   -634.     0.9

# The V5*V4 from both the upper/lower triangles
# covariance matrix changed from -181 to -634
